timeline.message:
Update for 4.1.0 Release

- Update for Javadocs.yml to move to correct folder
- Update the Code to Support multiple runs of Builds
	- Sequence only accepts a first version
	- DerbyMaster is optimized

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: intesting,  why this bootstrapAndLoad function was basically do nothing...
timeline.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: just curious, maybe long time ago, these codes were in bootstrapAndLoad() function?
timeline.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText: no - I added, and move the output statement.
replies.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText: good change, I did find in my local message.log, seems apply has been done again and again for all existing derby databases, really nice to see this change, I guess this should be able to fix the issue I see.  and btw, I guess we will always have to change this sequence.java whenever any schema update is made, really want to know how would we support upgrade from any previous version to this version ...
timeline.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: Originally I think this class was intended to be generic / agnostic to the specific schema getting created.  This is why its in fhir-database-utils and not fhir-persistence-schema
timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: this skips the apply when priorVersion == null, which is what that AllVersionHistoryService service always passes.  I see we don't use that any more, but i think we should also handle nulls here unless we totally remove it
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: yes - I accepted your change - a good guard is now in place.
replies.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Create a anew FHIRPersistenceContext configure with a FHIRHistoryContext
          
          
            
                 * Create a new FHIRPersistenceContext configure with a FHIRHistoryContext
timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText:
good to see that we don't create the versionhistoryService every time calling createSchema now!
just double check, createSchema is never called before runWithAdapter(), correct?
timeline.author: albertwang-ibm
lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: I didn't run into the situation where it was null.  I had some logging statements, and it was always zero or 1
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: Adding as it's a good guard (just in case)
replies.author: prb112
